title: What is RSI?
content: The Relative Strength Index (RSI) measures the speed and change of price movements. RSI > 70 is 'Overbought' (Sell signal?), RSI < 30 is 'Oversold' (Buy signal?).

title: Understanding Drawdown
content: Drawdown is the reduction in equity from a peak to a trough. A 10% drawdown requires an 11% gain to recover. Manage position sizing to limit this!

title: The Golden Rule of Risk
content: Never risk more than 1-2% of your capital on a single trade. This ensures you can survive a losing streak.

title: Stop Loss vs Trailing Stop
content: A fixed Stop Loss limits loss to X%. A Trailing Stop moves UP with the price, locking in profits while protecting against reversals.

title: What is VIX?
content: India VIX is the 'Fear Gauge'. High VIX (>20) means high volatility and fear. Low VIX (<12) means complacency. Option premiums shoot up when VIX is high.
